Subject: Content-Type appended to URLs (bug)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=452108496; y=MSz1IdkJPWqx9HPtIOZo2rONiRRcQoe_uhvWp2kLhs_plavFPHJBLEkLNhmCoAVol24

Hello,

I've been running Heritrix 1.14.3 for a while and I noticed that a =
quite high percentage of downloaded pages result in a 404 error. Investigat=
ing the problem, many of them appear to be composed of a normal URL plus a =
content-type appended to it. E.g.:

http://newyorkyearbook.com/2009/07/text=
/css

In this case, the page that takes there is: http://newyorkyearbook.co=
m/2009/07/
and here there is no link to "text/css" (neither absolute nor re=
lative).

Also some scripts lead to incorrect URLs, such as:

http://mediaf=
etcher.com/flv_player/swfobject.js

that leads to: http://mediafetcher.com/=
ShockwaveFlash.ShockwaveFlash.7

I suppose there is some bug in the way URL=
s are extracted by some of the extractors (the JavaScript one and maybe oth=
ers). Does anybody know of a workaround to this problem?
Or, can you point =
me to the classes and methods to check in order to try to fix the bug?

Tha=
nk you,

    Davide
